artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Yamashiroya Jinbei; Carver: Tanaka Ushinosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 178; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 52, p. 297.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; orange bands of flame, radiating in the manner of a starburst from bottom edge left of center, across picture plane, with black ground with curls of grey and starbursts of orange and yellow; men's bodies, swords and helmets flying and flipping behind and between flames; man on brown rearing horse at right
dimension: 14 × 9 1/2 in. (35.56 × 24.13 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Carver’s seal: 田中彫牛 {Tanaka hori Ushi} | Censor seal: 寅十改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
text: Satō Kazue-no-kami Masakiyo (R) and Shimura Masazō Katsutoyo (L). 佐藤主計守正清, 志村政蔵勝豊.
title: Picture of Masakiyo's Challenging Battle as Retold in the Chronicle of the Great Peace
